Description: Red pottery ostracon, two fragments now joined, from the body of a large vessel, interior grooved and exterior covered with a cream-coloured slip, with remains of at least forty-nine lines of black-painted demotic text, in three columns, on the exterior.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (389827) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/389827)
Condition: fair (text faded and worn in places)
Acquisition name: Purchased through: R J Moss & Co
